intro: Banisteriopsis acapulcensis var. llanensis, commonly known as the Llanensis balsam tree, is a tropical evergreen species native to parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and distinctive, often fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, orange-red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
